author: cmpilato
msg: More issue #1003 work.  Move copy ID inheritance calculation to
open_path() instead of make_path_mutable() (now that the calculation
isn't so expensive anymore).
* subversion/libsvn_fs/tree.c
(parent_path_t): Add 'copy_inherit', 'copy_src_path' members.
(parent_path_path): Just a relocation...nothing to see here.
(get_copy_inheritance): Was choose_copy_id().  Move up so open_path()
can use it.
(open_path): Use new get_copy_inheritance().
(make_path_mutable): No more choose_copy_id() -- just use the
pre-determined data in the parent_path.

author: gstein
msg: Get the cvs2svn tests running a bit better.
* cvs2svn/tests/cmptag.py:
(do_cvs2svn): invoke cvs2svn.py with the same executable that is
running self. since cvs2svn is supposed to work with Python 1.5.2,
its #! line references an unversioned "python" and that could be
wrong. sys.executable specifies the right proggie to use.
* cvs2svn/cvs2svn.py:
(Commit.commit): toss out _commit_internal() since the bug in the
bindings has been fixed. of course, that was quite nice of the
function to let us know :-)

author: gstein
msg: * tools/cvs2svn/tests/cmptag.py
(get_exec_flag): change += operator for Python 1.5.2 compat

author: gstein
msg: Fix the string typemaps and fix svn_fs_commit_txn.
* svn_string.i:
(const char **OUTPUT): the type of the typemap got dropped; this is
an "in" typemap, and it is not Python specific. switch to the
quoted form to reduce bulk in the generated file.
* svn_fs.i:
(%apply for OUT params): shift the 'const char **' handling to an
application of OUTPUT rather than OUTPARAM.
(svn_fs_commit_txn): commit a (untested) typemap that captures both
output parameters and manually builds a result tuple.

author: kraai
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/providers.c
(get_creds): Do not dereference susername and spassword if they are NULL.
